comments:
Recent workbench builds are throwing an exception when we do simple file 
deletes. The exception comes from LTK (see pasted entry below).

This could be the same as bug 72633, which has the same exception in the error 
log. This does not reproduce in a product (RAD) built on 7-September-04, so 
it's a recent regression.

The UI shows this error message:

An exception has been caught while processing the refactoring 'Delete'.
Reason:
 Problems encountered while deleting resources.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Create a new Java project
Change to java perspective
Right click on project name; choose new>file; create a plain empty file
Right click on the new file
Choose delete
Get the error message

This appears in the error log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ltk.ui.refactoring 4 10000 Sep 21, 2004 14:45:14.375
!MESSAGE Internal Error
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Problems encountered while deleting 
resources.
	at 
org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.UIPerformChangeOperation.executeChange
(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.ltk.core.refactoring.PerformChangeOperation.run(Unknown 
Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.ltk.internal.ui.refactoring.WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.run
(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(Unknown Source)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 4 Sep 21, 2004 14:45:14.390
!MESSAGE Problems encountered while deleting resources.
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 273 Sep 21, 2004 14:45:14.390
!MESSAGE Could not delete: E:\RAD\workspace\foo\probe.probe.

Further attempts to reproduce this show that it might only happen when a 
proprietary product is layered on top of Eclipse. I'm going to resolve this as 
WORKSFORME, and file a new one if we can get it to happen with bare Eclipse.
